column2: Fragrant Tree]] that grew in [[Númenor]], and especially in the western region known as [[Nísimaldar]]. It was the custom among [[Númenóreans
column3: Númenórean]] mariners to place a cut bough of oiolairë on the prows of their [[ships]], called the [[Green Bough of Return]], as a symbol of good fortune.<ref>{{UT

column1: The word ''oiolairë'' means "Ever-summer" in [[Quenya]] (from ''[[oio]]''= "endless period" and ''[[lairë]]''= "summer").{{fact}}
